WRITING.TITLE: My puppy won #8217;t potty outside
WRITING.TEXT: Last week I finally got the green light from my vet to let me walk my dog outside. He #8217;s been just fine and he #8217;s very good at walking with a leash, but the problem comes when he has to do his business. He holds it in for the whole walk and even after he smells everything he just won #8217;t pee and will just wait till we get back to the apartment to use his pee pad. Is this a normal thing? Or does it need training? also I #8217;ve walked him a total of four times but my vet said that he would potty outside automatically.
I live in an apartment so we have no garden, i was thinking of buying him one of those grass pads to see if he could get used to the texture at least :^(
I #8217;m in the same situation here but it #8217;s my mom the one who doesn #8217;t want the dog. I really hope that you find a way to manage your time better and develop a good routine. Good luck!

WRITING.TITLE: My dog doesn #8217;t like to walk
WRITING.TEXT: My 3 month old puppy is very energetic. He loves to run around the house and to play but when we go outside he isn #8217;t as half as energetic. The first thing he does when we go walking is sitting down or just completely laying down. I keep repeating to him the #8220;c #8217;mon #8221; command that used to work but now it doesn #8217;t. I have to pull his leash multiple times and say cmon to get him to get up. I used to think that I walked too fast and he couldn #8217;t catch up but no because even if i walk slow he won #8217;t even try to keep up. It #8217;s so frustrating. And sometimes i think maybe he #8217;s tired but the second we get home he starts running and jumping. I don #8217;t know what to do.

The walks are between 15 to 30 minutes, it #8217;s an immediate thing, he #8217;s a three month old yorkshire terrier and i live in an urban environment, a really busy city but i try to walk him on the less crowded and less noisy streets, sadly the closest park is a 1 hour walk away.

I have a three month old puppy and I don #8217;t have a crate so i just bought him a dog bed and i put it in my bedroom and he sleeps just fine. He wakes up sometimes to go to the bathroom but that #8217;s about it. He doesn #8217;t have behavioral issues or anything really, he does well when left alone so i think your pup should be just fine (but maybe don #8217;t put the box on your bed, idk)
About lesbian safe sex bc in my school they never mentioned queer sex just regular old straight cis sex :/

WRITING.TITLE: PIETRO PEED OUTSIDE YES !!!!
WRITING.TEXT: Pietro ( 3 month old yorkie ) has trouble walking and doing his business outside, so today i took him on a walk determined to do better. We walked very little because i wanted to focus less on exercise and more on him getting used to the environment and it worked !! He smelt the grass for a whole five minutes but finally he peed outside! I gave him a treat and celebrated him because this is such a big step for him! I #8217;m so proud. #129402; #10024;

I have a Yorkie and i always get this kind of comments from my veterinarian which sucks. My veterinarian hates dogs with all her soul she #8217;s told me this but she has a special hatred towards yorkies and chihuahuas and she always says stuff like #8220;Im surprised to see you dog is so nice, let #8217;s see how long it lasts. #8221; And I absolutely hate it because, unlike you i hadn #8217;t had to socially train him cuz he #8217;s just nice by default but it makes me feel bad bc I can #8217;t ask my vet about any behavioral issues without having her say mean things like that :(
Sadly I can #8217;t because the vet is my aunt and my mom pays half of it :(

Right now my city is on full quarantine which makes me feel even guiltier because im raising my dog in an ideal situation where I #8217;m there all day and I don #8217;t want him to feel bad when i go back to school and have to leave him alone for 8 hours everyday
because she loves cats (she has 4), actually she #8217;s told me that she #8217;d love to be a just cat veterinarian but most of her clients are dogs, ksjdksks.
Completely!!! My pup is literally the sweetest thing until 7pm where he becomes an absolute monster, runs, pees everything, bites everyone and screams like a demon.
3 months old, around 12 to 15 hours
The gigi onE KSJOSANOSKA finally someone said it skjfksnd

He #8217;s 3 months old, i have enforced naps (1 hour naps) during the weekdays to get through class but only in the mornings, I don #8217;t enforce naps on the weekends because my vet told me that using the crate so much time can cause behavioral issues
Doggy daycare sounds awesome! We don #8217;t have those kinds of things in my country but I #8217;m training him to be alone so i can go out and breathe a little!

YES! THOSE STICKS ARE AWESOME!!! They helped me so much for when i put my puppy in his play pen cuz I #8217;ll just give him one of those and he #8217;ll chew it until he falls asleep. #128526; #129304;

WRITING.TITLE: Stop excusing nasty behavior because of a puppy #8217;s breed !!!
WRITING.TEXT: I am absolutely done with this. People need to understand that nasty behavior in puppies is still nasty behavior regardless of the breed. So finally my family met my yorkie puppy and they love him but they #8217;re also incredibly annoying about him. My dog bites when we play and I #8217;ve been trying to train him to inhibit biting during playtime, but my family keeps saying that bites are not an issue and that it #8217;s cute. I #8217;m sorry but cUte????? Would it still be cute if it were a full grown german shepherd trying to bite you while you play? No it wouldn #8217;t, so it shouldn #8217;t be considered cute just because a dog is small. People are out here talking trash about bigger breeds when they do something nasty but is automatically cute when a small dog does the same thing. Makes no sense. People need to understand that a Pitbull doesn #8217;t equal bad and a Corgi doesn #8217;t equal good. All dogs can have behavioral issues regardless of their size and appearance and people need to understand that. I am absolutely done with everyone thinking my dog #8217;s nasty behaviors are cute just because he #8217;s tiny, because let me tell you it isn #8217;t cute when you just woke up, you open his crate and he starts bitting you.

I understand what you #8217;re saying, but what really annoys me more than the biting is that people will forgive any kind of behavior if it comes from a small dog. My best friend has a super well behaved pitbull and people think she #8217;s aggressive just because of the breed, while really bad behaved small dogs just get called cute. It makes me really sad to see my friend having to walk his dog with a muzzle just because people think she #8217;s aggressive when in reality it #8217;s nothing like that.
Tbh same here. My pup just gets too exited when we play and bites hARD
my vet told me that my yorkie could never play fetch because he #8217;s a hunter. Guess what, fetch is his favorite game, ksjdks

Yes I completely get that but even if people see the most well behaved pit ever they still think they #8217;re dangerous which makes me really sad because i know some pretty nice pits that don #8217;t deserve that reputation. :(
Just out of curiosity (english is not my first language) what does that expression mean? I #8217;ve heard it before but never in a dog related context

That #8217;s terrible, I #8217;m sorry. My dog is also turning into a nightmare for shit like that so now everytime someone visits i tell them to please not praise my dog #8217;s bad behavior bc he #8217;s in training. Doesn #8217;t work always but it #8217;s better than nothing. :/

Thank you those are honestly very good tips! I was really mad when i wrote that so yes my patience was wearing thin. My yorkie doesn #8217;t have any dog friends but whenever i walk him and i see other dogs i ask the owners if it would be okay for my dog to play with them for a bit. Im working really hard on trying to get him socialized ! I like to think I #8217;m pretty clear when i speak to him, i don #8217;t yell at him cuz i think that doesn #8217;t really work but i do use a different tone to let him know what he did is wrong. You sound like you #8217;re pretty experienced in dogs, do you have any tips on how to get him more socialized ? #129402;

YES! What #8217;s with people not training their dogs, like why #8217;d you get a dog in the first place then? Right? Kajdk. My dog (a yorkie) also gets aggressive when seeing bigger dogs and I #8217;m doing all i can to train him out of that nasty behavior but my mom always says #8220;he #8217;s just scared because he #8217;s tiny, let him be #8221; and honestly i would flip a table if any dog, regardless of it #8217;s size bit mine so it is my responsibility to train my dog to not bite others too!
I have never owned a dog before and it sounds like you have experience training! Do you have any tips for leash pulling? #129402; #128073; #128072; (cuz I #8217;m really struggling with that)
Treats are a must apparently, ksjks. So cool that you dog is so well behaved! I will try bringing treats to my dog #8217;s next walk, tysm for the tips !! #128526; #129304;

My dog and i have cuddle time in the morning but i have an alarm and he knows that there are no cuddles until that alarm sounds. Also he #8217;s only allowed in my bed during that specific moment and does not have free access to it for the rest of the day.

I #8217;ve had my puppy for almost two months and he #8217;s annoying af but just thinking of not waking up to his sweet face every day puts me in tears. He is the light of my life and i am really hoping that what they say about small dogs living up to 20 years is true because i love him with all my heart and I don #8217;t know what I #8217;d do without him.

WRITING.TITLE: How do I know if my puppy is being aggressive towards other dogs? #10024;
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;ve never owned a dog before or even been around dogs in my life so what may seem obvious to me it isn #8217;t. So I #8217;ve noticed a kinda weird attitude in my dog whenever he meets other dogs and I #8217;d love if someone could tell me what it means. So whenever we approach a dog he will starts leash pulling and throw his ears back. Then if the other dog also approaches him he #8217;ll sniff his face and starts kinda #8220;slapping #8221; the other dog with his paws and that #8217;s the moment when I pull him away because I #8217;m not sure if what he #8217;s doing is normal, friendly or aggressive. He doesn #8217;t bark or growl at them though. Please help, what does it mean? #129402;
Oh that #8217;s great!!! Tyms, now i can finally stay calm and let him play :D
okay! He kinda just looks at the other dog and then immediately starts sniffing his face, I #8217;m glad it #8217;s friendly behavior #9786; #65039;
Now that i know it #8217;s not aggressive i will stop pulling him! I don #8217;t want him to learn negative things #9786; #65039; #128077;

WRITING.TITLE: How to stop using treats when training a puppy? #129402; #10024;
WRITING.TEXT: Hi! I have a 3 month old Yorkshire Terrier and I #8217;m working on teaching him the sit command. He already knows how to sit on command but only when he sees the treat in my hand, when he doesn #8217;t see it he just stops caring. Any tips on how to fade away the treats while training? Because attention and affection don #8217;t really do it for him.
Thank you so much for this tip! I will definitely starts training this in today #8217;s training session. I #8217;ve also been working on hand signals which he surprisingly gets most times ! Tysm
I will definitely start doing this! Tysm (also sounds like an interesting guide ksjdks)
Okay! It #8217;s just that I #8217;m a little worried and speedrunning the training bc my vet told me that after four months they are no longer trainable :(
Maybe I misunderstood :( well it #8217;s a relief to hear that. I was already panicking bc I would be able to fully train him in a month
I hadn #8217;t thought about this! It #8217;s a great idea i will definitely start incorporating this!
I have a three month old and he loves searching for treats. Just hide some in a room and let your dog find them! It #8217;ll do wonders !
I will definitely try this! At what age do you think it #8217;d be appropriate to include the #8220;no treat #8221;? #129402;
These are some great recommendations thank you so much!!!
A playpen could be the solution? Idk i leave my puppy free roaming since week 2 of having him and I #8217;ve never had any issues
I usually hide five or four (small low calorie treats) around my room and he really enjoys it!

I hide them when i go outside for two to three hours and after he finds them he just gets in his crate and sleeps. Right now bc of the pandemic I #8217;m not going to school or work so I can #8217;t help u there :/

WRITING.TITLE: Crate or Playpen?
WRITING.TEXT: I recently wanted to buy my dog a crate since everyone speaks wonders about crate training but I realized they were awfully expensive, so I #8217;d like to know if it #8217;d be okay to crate train a dog but with a playpen. Right now and since I got my pup he #8217;s had a play pen with a little bed in it and a pee pad. It has done wonders for me because whenever i put him in it he #8217;ll sleep for at least two hours, and he also spends the whole night in there. So is it that bad to replace a crate for a playpen?
I #8217;m really short on space so do u think it #8217;d be cool if i put a crate inside the pen?

Do you have a playpen or a puppy proof room where you can leave him for idk 2 hours a day? I have a playpen and it #8217;s done wonders for my dog #8217;s behavior to the point where i can leave him alone and he #8217;ll got to the pen on his own!

I have a pup in a one bedroom apartment and the biggest problem for me has been potty training, I #8217;m not able to take my dog outside more than three times a day so we had to use pee pads which get really smelly after a couple hours but nothing else besides that! I mean the first few weeks are always crazy but that #8217;s not because of the apartment ksjdks

It #8217;s never to late to start that process! I really recommend the playpen, maybe you can start leaving him there for short periods of time, first day 15 min then 30 and then in no time he #8217;ll be in there for two hours, I promise! He #8217;ll learn to entertain himself with his own toys instead of doing bad things around the house :D

The first time I put my pup on his pen he cried for like five minutes and then he moved on with his life and napped. It is really probable that he #8217;ll cry the first few days but then he #8217;ll start to develop a routine and get comfortable with the pen/crate

I have a traveling cage/crate (idk what is called????) and he really likes that, do you think that it could be a substitute for the crate until i save enough to buy one? Also he #8217;s a small dog and won #8217;t get much bigger when he grows up so I #8217;m not worried about him jumping the fence, ksjsk.

WRITING.TITLE: [Rant] Trans student keeps getting misgendered in online class
WRITING.TEXT: First things first I want to clarify that I am not the person getting misgendered, but as a cis person it still makes me feel bad how some people will just not respect the identity of others. So there #8217;s this guy who i share a few classes with and a couple weeks ago he came out as trans ftm nobody said anything really, just me and my friend who were happy for him. Thing is, he changes his name on zoom, he puts his pronouns too and he even has the trans flag as his icon. But the teachers keep dead-naming him and using the wrong pronouns and it #8217;s so infuriating, do they not realize the damage they #8217;re doing to that student? If I were him I #8217;d feel like shit, so I can #8217;t even begin to imagine how he feels right now. He built up the courage to discover his true self and to come out to us and people treat him like that? So fucking disrespectful.

I hadn #8217;t corrected the teachers bc I didn #8217;t want to put my friend in the spotlight. People are kinda mean and I don #8217;t want to cause any trouble, but at this point I don #8217;t know if it #8217;s worse being missgendered (is it with one or two s idk) or having people think he #8217;s annoying. I just wished my teacher #8217;s head clicked and they realized that what they #8217;re doing is wrong.
I #8217;m sorry you have to go through that. I guess I #8217;ll start by contacting the guy because I wouldn #8217;t want to take any actions if he were uncomfortable with it
I think I will ask the guy first if he even wants my help bc if he doesn #8217;t that #8217;s completely fine and if he does I #8217;ll try to talk to the teachers who misgender him in private.
I #8217;m so sorry, I hope they eventually realize that what they #8217;re doing to you is wrong.

I am truly sorry for what you #8217;re experiencing, I could never imagine how bad it must feel to have your identity ignored and denied by others, the only time I #8217;ve come close to that is people telling me I #8217;m straight. I know I cannot help you that much with a comment but I just want you to know that if you ever need some support or someone to talk to, I #8217;m here! #128150;

I completely understand what you #8217;re saying but it #8217;s still kinda sad when i see the teacher reading his new name out loud and then saying on propuse, #8220;Oh, That #8217;s not your real name is it (dead name)? #8221; I just think it isn #8217;t tHat hard when the actual name with the preferred pronouns appears on screen every time he talks, it #8217;s like a constant reminder. But again I #8217;m not a teacher I #8217;m a student so maybe it is that hard.
Oh wow, I wish all teachers were like you. Your students are so lucky to have you!
I don #8217;t know if its ilegal or an offense in my country, chileans just be mean like that and don #8217;t care

I will talk to the guy first to see what he thinks about it, I wouldn #8217;t want to put him in a position that he #8217;d be uncomfortable with, but if he lets me i will definitely take action on this. My teachers have also discriminated against me for being a lesbian so I know that it #8217;s not because he #8217;s trans, it #8217;s because he #8217;s different. I am done with the discrimination in my school and I have to thank you and the rest of the people who have commented to help me realize that if I don #8217;t take action now this will never change.

Intento usar palabras sin g #233;nero lo cual igual es re dif #237;cil e intento no usar pronombres muy a menudo, me intento referir a la gente por su nombre, pero a veces igual hay que usar el g #233;nero. :(

Well I #8217;m not from the us and here the teachers have less students but still i feel like some of them do it on purpose. They will call his new name and be like, #8220;Who is (new name)? #8221; Even though he still has the same surname. I can see how some get it wrong the first few times, I did too but i can also see when someone genuinely wants to do better and help their students. :( it #8217;s really frustrating

I get what you #8217;re saying but I also don #8217;t want to put him in an uncomfortable position. I really do believe that I should talk to the guy first to see what he thinks about me taking action.

Do you have a problem? It #8217;s not that they don #8217;t remember, they are literally reading his name, it pops up on the screen every time he speaks. You #8217;d have to be fucking dumb to not be able to read a name.
I- Why are you calling your friend him then? ~ confusion, confuse yourself ~
I will totally do that!
That #8217;s a genius idea!

For what I know he spoke to the head teacher in private but he didn #8217;t come out publicly like in the middle of class. But it #8217;s kinda the responsibility of the head teacher to communicate the issue to the rest of the teachers.
